Description: Faience dish or plate; Egyptian or Egyptianising; thick-walled modelled construction; decorated in black paint with a man punting a papyrus boat accompanied by a bull or a cow sitting under a canopy, a fish swims below; at the rim a border of double framed running lozenges with a dot in the centre; well-preserved blue glaze in some areas, faded to white in others; this is the only vessel of this type known with a low ring base, which has been applied separately to the vessel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 164)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.22,35, Fig 63)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2008-2009 18 Nov-15 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, 'Beyond Babylon: Art, Trade, and Diplomacy in the Second Millennium B.C.'
